benchmark_details.name: NiM-Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: NiM-Benchmark is designed to evaluate Multi-modal Large Language Models' (MLLMs) ability to locate and reason about fine-grained details within complex documents, including newspapers, menus, and academic materials.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess MLLMs' effectiveness in extracting precise information from visually rich document layouts.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Although our method performs well on existing DocVQA datasets, it struggles with long length documents.

data.source: Curated documents from multiple domains including academic papers, newspapers, magazines, restaurant menus, and lecture screenshots.
data.annotation: Hybrid approach: initially generated by MLLMs and then verified by human annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on model predictions against human-validated ground truths.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in accurately answering questions about fine-grained details.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o baseline performance scores on NiM-Benchmark.
methodology.validation: Rigorously validated through both automated methods and human assessments.
